{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "General Manager",
  "description": "HRecruitershub is a private company into Human Resources and Advisory Service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Industry: Advisory Services

Position Summary


	As a General Manager you will lead on business transformation projects including restructuring execution, turnaround, execution, operational excellence, strategic operations, operational strategy, operational consulting transformation and M&amp;A post merger implementation and digital transformation projects.
	You will work at a deep level across our clients&rsquo; businesses, working in teams to build the capabilities, systems and processes needed to deliver bottom-line results and then ensure those results will be sustained.
	You will also lead, coach, and motivate your team of consultants and client employees in each project.
	In addition you will act as a subject matter expert, combining experience with strong problem-solving abilities to derive business insights and solid recommendations for clients.
	Another part of your impact is to contribute to the implementation of our delivery groups growth strategy, and you will take responsibility on the development of the firm and grow in a stimulating and human environment where quality of life at work is important.
	You will be based in our Lagos office, working closely and in partnership with client&#39;s senior management and their specialist departments.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree, preferably in financial or similar field with strong record of academic achievement
	9+ years of professional experience including some coming from a consulting environment with high problem solving ability and project management delivery
	8+ years of experience delivering and execution large scale business transformation projects including: restructuring, turnaround, operational excellence, strategic operations, operational strategy, operational consulting transformation and M&amp;A PMI (post merger implementation) or digital transformation projects
	Private sector experience Oil and Gas, Financial Services, Energyis highly desirable
	Experience developing business unit strategy and leading large-scale business change programs, preferably while establishing strong relationships with senior clients
	Experience leading people and building teams, empowering team members to achieve impact
	You enjoy the flexibility and agility that is required in a consulting environment
	Experienced in conducting workshops, thought leadership and coaching sessions
	Driven by creating long-lasting impact and enjoy leading teams to achieve results.


Remuneration
Very attractive.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrecruitershub@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

General Manager Job at HRecruitershub




        
    

        
        HRecruitershub is a private company into Human Resources and Advisory Service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Industry: Advisory Services

Position Summary
     

            
    




	As a General Manager you will lead on business transformation projects including restructuring execution, turnaround, execution, operational excellence, strategic operations, operational strategy, operational consulting transformation and M&A post merger implementation and digital transformation projects.
	You will work at a deep level across our clients’ businesses, working in teams to build the capabilities, systems and processes needed to deliver bottom-line results and then ensure those results will be sustained.
	You will also lead, coach, and motivate your team of consultants and client employees in each project.
	In addition you will act as a subject matter expert, combining experience with strong problem-solving abilities to derive business insights and solid recommendations for clients.
	Another part of your impact is to contribute to the implementation of our delivery groups growth strategy, and you will take responsibility on the development of the firm and grow in a stimulating and human environment where quality of life at work is important.
	You will be based in our Lagos office, working closely and in partnership with client's senior management and their specialist departments.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor’s degree, preferably in financial or similar field with strong record of academic achievement
	9+ years of professional experience including some coming from a consulting environment with high problem solving ability and project management delivery
	8+ years of experience delivering and execution large scale business transformation projects including: restructuring, turnaround, operational excellence, strategic operations, operational strategy, operational consulting transformation and M&A PMI (post merger implementation) or digital transformation projects
	Private sector experience Oil and Gas, Financial Services, Energyis highly desirable
	Experience developing business unit strategy and leading large-scale business change programs, preferably while establishing strong relationships with senior clients
	Experience leading people and building teams, empowering team members to achieve impact
	You enjoy the flexibility and agility that is required in a consulting environment
	Experienced in conducting workshops, thought leadership and coaching sessions
	Driven by creating long-lasting impact and enjoy leading teams to achieve results.


Remuneration
Very attractive.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrecruitershub@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Architect",
  "description": "Nine Stars Limited is a dynamic and innovative agricultural and real estate company committed to transforming Nigeria&rsquo;s market landscape. Based in Ode-Remo, Saapade, Ogun State, our company aims to provide unparalleled agricultural and real estate solutions, offering a wide range of services that cater to the diverse needs of individuals and businesses alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Architect
Job Location:&nbsp;Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Architect with a minimum of four (4) years of professional experience to join our team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, planning, and overseeing architectural projects from concept through completion, ensuring functionality, safety, sustainability, and compliance with relevant regulations.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop architectural designs, concepts, drawings, and specifications for residential, commercial, or mixed-use projects.
	Prepare and review detailed architectural drawings using relevant design software.
	Coordinate with clients to understand project requirements, budgets, and timelines.
	Collaborate with engineers, contractors, and other consultants to ensure integrated project delivery.
	Ensure all designs comply with local building codes, planning regulations, and industry standards.
	Conduct site visits to monitor progress, quality, and adherence to approved designs.
	Review and approve shop drawings, material selections, and construction methods.
	Manage design revisions and address technical issues during construction.
	Prepare project reports and provide regular updates to management and clients.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Architecture or a related field (Master&rsquo;s degree is an advantage).
	Minimum of four (4) years of proven work experience as an Architect.
	Proficiency in architectural design and drafting software (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit, ArchiCAD, SketchUp, Lumion, or similar tools).
	Strong knowledge of building materials, construction methods, and architectural standards.
	Good understanding of local planning regulations and building codes.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and client-management skills.
	Strong attention to detail, creativity, and problem-solving ability.
	Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.


Key Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Architectural design and space planning
	Project coordination and site supervision
	Technical drawing and documentation
	Team collaboration and leadership
	Time and budget management.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary between&nbsp;N250,000 &ndash; N500,000 monthly (based on experience and qualifications), commensurate with experience
	Opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects
	Professional growth and career development opportunities
	Supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their Resume, Cover
letter, and Architecture portfolio&nbsp;to:&nbsp;ninestars.recruitment@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

Architect Job at Nine Stars Limited




        
    

        
        Nine Stars Limited is a dynamic and innovative agricultural and real estate company committed to transforming Nigeria’s market landscape. Based in Ode-Remo, Saapade, Ogun State, our company aims to provide unparalleled agricultural and real estate solutions, offering a wide range of services that cater to the diverse needs of individuals and businesses alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Architect
Job Location: Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Architect with a minimum of four (4) years of professional experience to join our team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, planning, and overseeing architectural projects from concept through completion, ensuring functionality, safety, sustainability, and compliance with relevant regulations.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop architectural designs, concepts, drawings, and specifications for residential, commercial, or mixed-use projects.
	Prepare and review detailed architectural drawings using relevant design software.
	Coordinate with clients to understand project requirements, budgets, and timelines.
	Collaborate with engineers, contractors, and other consultants to ensure integrated project delivery.
	Ensure all designs comply with local building codes, planning regulations, and industry standards.
	Conduct site visits to monitor progress, quality, and adherence to approved designs.
	Review and approve shop drawings, material selections, and construction methods.
	Manage design revisions and address technical issues during construction.
	Prepare project reports and provide regular updates to management and clients.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture or a related field (Master’s degree is an advantage).
	Minimum of four (4) years of proven work experience as an Architect.
	Proficiency in architectural design and drafting software (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit, ArchiCAD, SketchUp, Lumion, or similar tools).
	Strong knowledge of building materials, construction methods, and architectural standards.
	Good understanding of local planning regulations and building codes.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and client-management skills.
	Strong attention to detail, creativity, and problem-solving ability.
	Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Architectural design and space planning
	Project coordination and site supervision
	Technical drawing and documentation
	Team collaboration and leadership
	Time and budget management.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary between N250,000 – N500,000 monthly (based on experience and qualifications), commensurate with experience
	Opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects
	Professional growth and career development opportunities
	Supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their Resume, Cover
letter, and Architecture portfolio to: ninestars.recruitment@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Based in Ode-Remo, Saapade, Ogun State, our company aims to provide unparalleled agricultural and real estate solutions, offering a wide range of services that cater to the diverse needs of individuals and businesses alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical Designer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Mechanical Designer with a minimum of 5 years&rsquo; hands-on experience in mechanical design and drafting.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating, developing, and improving mechanical designs while ensuring functionality, efficiency, and compliance with industry standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and develop mechanical components, systems, and assemblies.
	Produce detailed 2D and 3D drawings using CAD software.
	Review and improve existing mechanical designs for performance and cost efficiency.
	Collaborate with engineers, project managers, and production teams.
	Ensure designs meet safety, quality, and regulatory standards.
	Conduct design calculations, material selection, and tolerance analysis.
	Support prototyping, testing, and product development processes.
	Prepare technical documentation and design reports.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	HND / B.Sc in Mechanical Engineering or a related field (preferred).
	Minimum of 5 years of proven experience as a Mechanical Designer or similar role.
	Strong proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks, Inventor, CATIA, or similar).
	Solid understanding of mechanical engineering principles, materials, and manufacturing processes.
	Ability to interpret technical drawings and specifications.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and time management skills.


Benefits


	Monthly salary between N300,000 &ndash; N500,000 monthly (based on experience and skill level)&nbsp;based on experience and expertise.
	Opportunities for professional growth and skill development.
	Supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Mechanical Designer Job at Nine Stars Limited




        
    

        
        Nine Stars Limited is a dynamic and innovative agricultural and real estate company committed to transforming Nigeria’s market landscape. Based in Ode-Remo, Saapade, Ogun State, our company aims to provide unparalleled agricultural and real estate solutions, offering a wide range of services that cater to the diverse needs of individuals and businesses alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical Designer
Job Location: Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Mechanical Designer with a minimum of 5 years’ hands-on experience in mechanical design and drafting.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating, developing, and improving mechanical designs while ensuring functionality, efficiency, and compliance with industry standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and develop mechanical components, systems, and assemblies.
	Produce detailed 2D and 3D drawings using CAD software.
	Review and improve existing mechanical designs for performance and cost efficiency.
	Collaborate with engineers, project managers, and production teams.
	Ensure designs meet safety, quality, and regulatory standards.
	Conduct design calculations, material selection, and tolerance analysis.
	Support prototyping, testing, and product development processes.
	Prepare technical documentation and design reports.


Requirements & Qualifications


	HND / B.Sc in Mechanical Engineering or a related field (preferred).
	Minimum of 5 years of proven experience as a Mechanical Designer or similar role.
	Strong proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks, Inventor, CATIA, or similar).
	Solid understanding of mechanical engineering principles, materials, and manufacturing processes.
	Ability to interpret technical drawings and specifications.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and time management skills.


Benefits


	Monthly salary between N300,000 – N500,000 monthly (based on experience and skill level) based on experience and expertise.
	Opportunities for professional growth and skill development.
	Supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV alongside their portfolio showcasing relevant mechanical design projects to: ninestars.recruitment@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Fullstack Developer",
  "description": "StraitPay is rebuilding how African businesses move money across borders &mdash; starting with Nigerian SMEs. We&#39;re launching a new product and go-to-market motion built on hard-earned lessons, deep regulatory expertise, and insights from thousands of past users.

straitPay helps Nigerian businesses make fast, transparent, and affordable cross-border payments. Our new direction is focused, bold, and designed to win. We&rsquo;re a small team with big ambitions, backed by years of experience and a fresh operating model. With the right strategy, people, and product &mdash; we&rsquo;re ready to execute.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Fullstack Developer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As a Fullstack Developer, you will report directly to the CTO; and will equally play a key role in designing and maintaining the backbone of straitPay&rsquo;s applications, supporting the CTO in providing technical guidance to the development team.
	You will design and ship end to end systems, partner tightly with Product, Design, Customer Success, Sales and Marketing on real customer workflows, and turn vague problems into shippable software with speed and quality.


Key Responsibilities


	Take ownership of engineering delivery end-to-end, from designing solutions and prioritising work through implementation, release and post-deployment support.
	Design, build and maintain high quality full-stack systems, ensuring features are shipped reliably, on time and to a high standard.
	Ensure the platform remains secure, reliable and performant, contributing to effective monitoring, alerting, incident response and recovery practices.
	Collaborate closely with Product, Design, and business stakeholders to ensure technical decisions and delivery outcomes stay aligned with business priorities, customer needs, and compliance requirements.
	Contribute to architectural decisions and system design, helping evolve the platform without unnecessary complexity or delivery friction.
	Champion engineering excellence through clean, maintainable code, strong documentation, automated testing, CI/CD best practices and a mindset of continuous improvement.
	Provide technical guidance and mentorship through code reviews and design discussions, leading by example as a senior individual contributor.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
	5+ years of professional experience in fullstack development and mobile app development.


Required Skills / Experience:


	Strong background working in regulated or compliance driven environments, preferably within fintech or financial services.
	Demonstrated experience working in agile delivery environments with modern engineering practices.
	Experience working with engineering teams delivering critical platforms with high uptime, security and performance requirements.
	Proven experience working with cloud native architectures, microservices, CI/CD pipelines and API-driven ecosystems.
	Experience operating in regulated or compliance driven environments (e.g., banking regulatory frameworks) is a strong advantage.


Technology Stack:


	Backend: Node.js, NestJS, TypeScript
	Frontend: React, Next.js
	Mobile: React Native
	Databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB
	Cloud: AWS
	CI/CD: GitHub Actions.


What you&#39;ll get


	Be part of a fast-growing fintech transforming financial access in Africa.
	Work in a dynamic and innovative environment with global exposure.
	Competitive compensation and benefits.
	A mission-driven company where your work directly contributes to empowering Africans worldwide.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-09",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-17",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "StraitPay"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Senior Fullstack Developer Job at StraitPay




        
    

        
        StraitPay is rebuilding how African businesses move money across borders — starting with Nigerian SMEs. We're launching a new product and go-to-market motion built on hard-earned lessons, deep regulatory expertise, and insights from thousands of past users.

straitPay helps Nigerian businesses make fast, transparent, and affordable cross-border payments. Our new direction is focused, bold, and designed to win. We’re a small team with big ambitions, backed by years of experience and a fresh operating model. With the right strategy, people, and product — we’re ready to execute.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Fullstack Developer
Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As a Fullstack Developer, you will report directly to the CTO; and will equally play a key role in designing and maintaining the backbone of straitPay’s applications, supporting the CTO in providing technical guidance to the development team.
	You will design and ship end to end systems, partner tightly with Product, Design, Customer Success, Sales and Marketing on real customer workflows, and turn vague problems into shippable software with speed and quality.


Key Responsibilities


	Take ownership of engineering delivery end-to-end, from designing solutions and prioritising work through implementation, release and post-deployment support.
	Design, build and maintain high quality full-stack systems, ensuring features are shipped reliably, on time and to a high standard.
	Ensure the platform remains secure, reliable and performant, contributing to effective monitoring, alerting, incident response and recovery practices.
	Collaborate closely with Product, Design, and business stakeholders to ensure technical decisions and delivery outcomes stay aligned with business priorities, customer needs, and compliance requirements.
	Contribute to architectural decisions and system design, helping evolve the platform without unnecessary complexity or delivery friction.
	Champion engineering excellence through clean, maintainable code, strong documentation, automated testing, CI/CD best practices and a mindset of continuous improvement.
	Provide technical guidance and mentorship through code reviews and design discussions, leading by example as a senior individual contributor.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
	5+ years of professional experience in fullstack development and mobile app development.


Required Skills / Experience:


	Strong background working in regulated or compliance driven environments, preferably within fintech or financial services.
	Demonstrated experience working in agile delivery environments with modern engineering practices.
	Experience working with engineering teams delivering critical platforms with high uptime, security and performance requirements.
	Proven experience working with cloud native architectures, microservices, CI/CD pipelines and API-driven ecosystems.
	Experience operating in regulated or compliance driven environments (e.g., banking regulatory frameworks) is a strong advantage.


Technology Stack:


	Backend: Node.js, NestJS, TypeScript
	Frontend: React, Next.js
	Mobile: React Native
	Databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB
	Cloud: AWS
	CI/CD: GitHub Actions.


What you'll get


	Be part of a fast-growing fintech transforming financial access in Africa.
	Work in a dynamic and innovative environment with global exposure.
	Competitive compensation and benefits.
	A mission-driven company where your work directly contributes to empowering Africans worldwide.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

            
    




   


    
        Similar Jobs

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Graphic Designer / Digital Content Administrator",
  "description": "Vethan Concepts Group Limited is a dynamic, multi-disciplinary holding company with interests across diverse industries, including Import and export, Sales and distribution, Technology, Entertainment, Agriculture, Construction and real estate, Consulting.
Founded on the principles of innovation, integrity, and impact, we bring together expertise and enterprise to deliver solutions that are future focused and socially responsible.

Headquartered in Lagos-Nigeria, Vethan Concepts Group is driven by a bold ambition: to be a catalyst for transformation. Our integrated business model allows us to adapt rapidly, seize opportunities, and create lasting value for stakeholders across sectors and borders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Designer / Digital Content Administrator

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Graphic Designer &amp; Digital Content Administrator leads the visual identity of the brand. This role requires a seasoned creative who can translate complex marketing objectives into engaging visual stories.
	You will be responsible for the end-to-end creation of visual assets while ensuring they are effectively administered across all digital touchpoints.


Key Responsibilities


	Creative Direction: Lead the brainstorming and development of visual content strategies that align with long-term marketing goals.
	High-Level Design: Produce professional-grade graphics, infographics, motion graphics, and video content for social media, websites, and email campaigns.
	Brand Stewardship: Develop and maintain brand style guides to ensure visual consistency across all sister companies and platforms.
	Asset Management &amp; Administration: Organize and manage the digital asset library; oversee the scheduling and uploading of content via CMS and social media management tools.
	UI/UX Collaboration: Work with the web team to ensure that digital content is not only beautiful but also functional and user-friendly.
	Performance Optimization: Monitor how visual content performs (A/B testing designs) and adjust creative strategies based on engagement data.
	Cross-Functional Support: Provide design support for internal presentations, corporate reports, and event branding.
	Other Duties: Carrying out assigned duties for the company and sister companies as required.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Experience: 3&ndash;5 years of proven experience in a graphic design or digital media role.
	Education: BSc in Computer Science, Fine Arts, or Marketing.
	Technical: Expert proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (AI, PS, PR, AE) and Figma/Sketch.
	Admin: Strong knowledge of Content Management Systems (CMS) and SEO for image optimization.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their Resume to:&nbsp;hr@vcgl.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-09",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Vethan Concepts Group Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

Graphic Designer / Digital Content Administrator Job at Vethan Concepts Group Limited




        
    

        
        Vethan Concepts Group Limited is a dynamic, multi-disciplinary holding company with interests across diverse industries, including Import and export, Sales and distribution, Technology, Entertainment, Agriculture, Construction and real estate, Consulting.
Founded on the principles of innovation, integrity, and impact, we bring together expertise and enterprise to deliver solutions that are future focused and socially responsible.

Headquartered in Lagos-Nigeria, Vethan Concepts Group is driven by a bold ambition: to be a catalyst for transformation. Our integrated business model allows us to adapt rapidly, seize opportunities, and create lasting value for stakeholders across sectors and borders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Graphic Designer / Digital Content Administrator

Job Location: Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Graphic Designer & Digital Content Administrator leads the visual identity of the brand. This role requires a seasoned creative who can translate complex marketing objectives into engaging visual stories.
	You will be responsible for the end-to-end creation of visual assets while ensuring they are effectively administered across all digital touchpoints.


Key Responsibilities


	Creative Direction: Lead the brainstorming and development of visual content strategies that align with long-term marketing goals.
	High-Level Design: Produce professional-grade graphics, infographics, motion graphics, and video content for social media, websites, and email campaigns.
	Brand Stewardship: Develop and maintain brand style guides to ensure visual consistency across all sister companies and platforms.
	Asset Management & Administration: Organize and manage the digital asset library; oversee the scheduling and uploading of content via CMS and social media management tools.
	UI/UX Collaboration: Work with the web team to ensure that digital content is not only beautiful but also functional and user-friendly.
	Performance Optimization: Monitor how visual content performs (A/B testing designs) and adjust creative strategies based on engagement data.
	Cross-Functional Support: Provide design support for internal presentations, corporate reports, and event branding.
	Other Duties: Carrying out assigned duties for the company and sister companies as required.


Qualifications & Skills


	Experience: 3–5 years of proven experience in a graphic design or digital media role.
	Education: BSc in Computer Science, Fine Arts, or Marketing.
	Technical: Expert proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (AI, PS, PR, AE) and Figma/Sketch.
	Admin: Strong knowledge of Content Management Systems (CMS) and SEO for image optimization.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their Resume to: hr@vcgl.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
